full_summary:
### Business Risk Management Program Assessment
**(Canada)**

The Government of Canada has issued a Request for Proposal (RFP) for the assessment of Business Risk Management (BRM) program incentives and disincentives that may impact climate change adaptation or mitigation on farms.

#### Project Description

Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada (AAFC) aims to identify how BRM programs can contribute to reducing the agriculture sector's climate change footprint and encourage farmers to adapt to climate change. AAFC seeks expertise to conduct two lines of inquiry related to BRM programs:

a. Identify elements of BRM program design and implementation that may influence producer incentives or disincentives for climate change adaptation and/or mitigation.
b. Assess potential changes to BRM program design to enhance producer incentives or minimize disincentives for climate change adaptation or mitigation.

The analysis will be informed by BRM principles, and the results will provide valuable insights for AAFC to inform future program development.

#### Tender Details

* Solicitation Number: 01B68-23-2656
* Tender Closing Date: March 18, 2024 (13:00:00)
* Expected Contract Start Date: None
* Expected Contract End Date: March 31, 2025
* Tender Status: Expired
* Procurement Category: SRV (Services)
* Procurement Method: Competitive - Open Bidding
* Selection Criteria: Highest Combined Rating of Technical Merit and Price

#### Attachment

The RFP document is available for download on the Canada Buys website. Please visit [https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/32730/rfp-01b68-23-2656---assessment-brm-incentives-disincentives\_en\_1.pdf](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/32730/rfp-01b68-23-2656---assessment-brm-incentives-disincentives\_en\_1.pdf) for more information.

#### Contact Information

* Name: Eleana Duff
* Email: eleana.duff@agr.gc.ca
* Phone: 555555
* Address: 1341 Baseline Road, Ottawa, Ontario, K1A 0C5, Canada

Note: I made the following changes:

* Rephrased the project description to make it more concise and clear
* Removed unnecessary words and sentences
* Standardized the formatting and used
